intro: Monimia amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping monimia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, where the leaves partially encircle the stem. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Monimia amplexicaulis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
